advice.eng: Everything you can drink from a glass or a mug can be regarded as fluids. Examples are: soup, coffee, tea, water, milk, fruit juice, etc. Yoghurt is mainly regarded as a dessert, but in some conditions, it can be seen as fluid. When it is categorized as fluid, this has been explained by your physician or dietician.

content.eng: Which of the following options is not labeled as fluid?
What advice did the doctor or dietitian give you on fluid intake?

advice.eng: In heart failure, the heart is not able to pump enough blood to the whole body. If you’re drinking a lot, this pump will be even more overloaded. Therefore, it is important to restrict fluid intake to 1.5-liter fluid per day (depends on physician advice). In case of hot weather, fever or diarrhea the physician may allow you to drink 150-300ml extra.

content.eng: How much are you allowed to drink per day?
How many glasses (=200ml) of water, milk, fruit juice or soda did you drink in total yesterday?

advice.eng: Sodium is a part of salt: 1 gram of salt is not the same as 1 gram of sodium. You can easily calculate the amount of salt by: sodium x 2.5 = salt.

content.eng: Sodium is a different word for salt?
How many small cups (=150 ml) of coffee or tea did you drink in total yesterday?

advice.eng: Sodium, which is a part of salt, is able to retain fluid which can cause shortness of breath and other signs of deterioration. In addition, too much salt can cause high blood pressure. The maximum of one teaspoon of salt (equals 6g) is recommended by most dieticians. However, it is advisable to follow your dietician’s guidelines when these are different.

content.eng: How much salt am I allowed to eat per day?
How many bowls (=250ml) of soup did you drink yesterday?

advice.eng: Weight and height can be used to calculate the body mass index (BMI) which gives an idea whether you have a healthy weight or not.

content.eng: How can you know whether you have a normal weight?

text.eng: you measure your weight (kg) and height (m)
you measure your waist (cm) and height (m)

content.eng: How many portions (=125g) of yogurt, pudding did you eat yesterday?

advice.eng: Fat between the organs results in a higher waist circumference and has a negative effect on your health, in particular for your heart.

content.eng: Why is the circumference of your waist important for your health? It represents the amount of?

advice.eng: Alcohol may cause damage to the heart muscle and the pump function and is therefore completely prohibited during the first 6 months after your diagnosis. After that period it should be limited to one or maximum 2 glasses per day.

content.eng: How many glasses (=125ml) of alcohol did you consume yesterday?

advice.eng: Fat intake should be limited because it contains a lot of calories, which has a negative effect on your weight. There are two types of fat but not all types are bad for your health: fat from animal origin is called saturated fat and should be avoided as much as possible. The other type is unsaturated fat which has a vegetable origin and is good for your cholesterol.

content.eng: What type of fat is dangerous for your health?
How many ice cubes (=15ml) did you consume yesterday?

advice.eng: Salmon contains a lot of fat, but from a different type namely unsaturated fat which works protective for your heart. It is recommended to eat fish twice a week, of which once fatty fish such as salmon or mackerel.

content.eng: In what kind of food you cannot find saturated fat?

advice.eng: Your total fluid intake (%s L) is too high. Therefore it is advisable to drink %s L per day, as recommended by your physician. 1 or 2 portions of fruit are not included in the calculation of the total fluid intake. To keep the feeling of thirst under control, the following tips can help: sugar-free chewing gum and peppermint, ice cubes, fruit, lemon juice in water or tea, products based on sour milk such as yoghurt and buttermilk, bitter drinks such as tonic, sour fruit juices such as lemon juice, coffee or tea without sugar, rinsing the mouth with water or using a water spray, brushing your teeth. The following drinks give a feeling of thirst: sweet and savory products, products based on sweetened milk such as ice cream and yoghurt, soft drinks and fruit juices, coffee or tea with sugar or honey, spicy dishes, liquorice.

content.eng: How many portions of nutrition drink did you consume yesterday?

advice.eng: Omega 3 is essential for a good health by stimulating a better blood flow, but is not present in the body itself. Therefore, it is necessary to have a sufficient intake via your food. Omega 3 is present in fish and vegetable oils, except for palm oil and coconut oil.

content.eng: Why do we need unsaturated fat?

advice.eng: Please ask the person cooking for you to avoid adding salt to your food. Choose a low salt and fat diet if possible.

content.eng: Who is cooking at home?

advice.eng: Cholesterol is needed to build cells in your body and comes in the blood through two different ways: through the body itself which produces cholesterol and through food with a high amount of animal fat.

content.eng: What is not a source of cholesterol?
Do you pay attention to indication on packages like no added salt - light - no added sugar?

advice.eng: There are two types of cholesterol: the good cholesterol will clean up the excessive amount of cholesterol in the body and thus results in cleaner blood vessels and is good for your heart. Bad cholesterol will stay in the blood vessels and narrow them with problems for your heart as a result.

content.eng: Is cholesterol always bad for your health?
How often do you add salt to food at the table?

advice.eng: Protein intake is needed to build cells in your body, but an excessive intake of proteins may cause damage to your kidneys. Therefore, the intake of meat, eggs, milk products and legumes is restricted.

content.eng: Which products contain a lot of proteins?

advice.eng: Sodium, which is a part of salt, is able to retain fluid which can cause shortness of breath and other signs of deterioration. In addition, too much salt can cause high blood pressure. Salt is already present in a wide variety of food such as cheeses, smoked meat and fish, canned food, ready-to-eat meals. Therefore, adding salt to your meals should be avoided. As an alternative, you can use some herbs to give extra flavor to your meals. If you use low-salt spices, please pay attention to the potassium level which should also be limited.

content.eng: Do you or family members add salt when cooking potatoes or vegetables?

advice.eng: All these different types of carbohydrate do increase the glucose level in your blood but the added sugars, which are typically found in pastries and chocolate, give a sharper increase of your blood sugar and are unnecessary.

content.eng: There are different types of sugar, which one is the least healthy one?

advice.eng: Brown bread is healthier than white types of bread because it contains more fibers and less fat. Whole-grain French bread and rolls are preferable to their white counterparts. Avoid pastries and limit the consumption of special breads such as sugar bread or raisin bread to maximum once per week.

content.eng: What type of bread did you eat the most during the previous week?

advice.eng: Physical activity is important to keep your weight and blood sugar under control. Even a small amount of daily activity, such as a short walk or taking the stairs, has an important effect.

content.eng: Which activity has the largest effect on your blood sugar?

advice.eng: Cheese spread and melting cheese contain a lot of salt, even the low-fat variants should be avoided. Only the low-fat and semi-fat hard cheeses are recommended (max 30+ or 18% fat), but should be limited to once per week. Low-fat soft curd cheese and cottage cheese are advisable and can be consumed with some sugar and herbs or with fresh fruits.

content.eng: If you choose cheese as a topping for your bread, what did you take the most during the last week?

advice.eng: Low-fat meat products such as cooked ham, turkey, chicken, cooked bacon, roast beef, steak tartare is recommended. Smoked meat and fish should be avoided, since they contain a lot of salt, even the low-fat variants. Low-fat non-smoked fish is a good alternative for meat. Boiled eggs may be a good alternative for meat, but should be limited to two per week.

content.eng: If you choose meat as a topping for your bread, what did you take the most during the last week?

advice.eng: Sweet toppings should be consumed in moderation because of the high level of sugar. Jam without added sugars may be a good alternative.

content.eng: If you choose sweet toppings on your bread, what did you take the most during the week?

advice.eng: An extra portion of vegetables is recommended with your lunch to have a sufficient intake of fibers and vitamins and does not contain calories and sugars.

content.eng: How often did you eat vegetables as a side dish with your lunch during the last week?

advice.eng: Hard types of fat such as butter contain a lot of saturated fatty acids which influence your cholesterol negatively. Therefore, soft types or liquid fats or oils which contain more unsaturated fats, are preferable.

content.eng: What type of fat/oils did you use the most when cooking a meal during the last week?

advice.eng: It is recommended to choose low-fat types and unprocessed meat such as beef, veal, chicken, turkey, venison. Processed meat such as sausage, minced meat, burgers, schnitzels should be avoided. A maximum of 100 to 120-gram meat for dinner is recommended.

content.eng: What type of meat did you eat the most during the last week?

advice.eng: Fish is a healthy alternative for meat and should therefore be eaten twice per week.

content.eng: How often did you eat fish during the last week?

advice.eng: Choose at least once per week a fatty type of fish such as salmon or mackerel because these types contain healthy fatty acids which are necessary for your body. Both fresh fish and frozen fish are advisable, but avoid canned or smoked fish, shrimps, oysters and mussels because these contain a lot of salt.

content.eng: What type of fish did you eat, if any?

advice.eng: A daily large portion of vegetables is recommended. Choose fresh or frozen vegetables to prepare your dinner, but avoid canned vegetables because these contain a lot of salt.

content.eng: How often did you eat vegetables with your dinner last week?
How often did you eat cooked potatoes during the last week?

advice.eng: Fried and baked potatoes contain a lot of fat and therefore this should be limited to only once per 2 weeks (in a vegetable oil).

content.eng: How often did you eat baked or fried potatoes during the last week?

advice.eng: Cooked potatoes and whole-grain pasta or rice don’t contain any fat and only a limited amount of salt.

content.eng: How often did you eat whole-grain pasta during the last week?

advice.eng: Whole-grain pasta is a better choice than regular pasta because it does not contain any fat and only a limited amount of salt.

content.eng: How often did you eat regular pasta during the last week?
How often did you eat whole-grain rice during the last week?

advice.eng: Whole-grain rice is a better choice than regular rice because it does not contain any fat and only a limited amount of salt.

content.eng: How often did you eat regular rice during the last week?

advice.eng: At least 1 but ideal 2 portions of fresh fruit are recommended on a daily basis.

content.eng: How much portions of fruit did you eat on average during the last week?

advice.eng: Besides fresh fruit, also yoghurt and pudding are healthy desserts.

content.eng: What type of dessert did you choose the most during the last week?
